user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtMem2BinFile:
```c
bool UtMem2BinFile(const void *Memory, const char *Filename, uint32 Length)
{
    FILE *fp;

    if ((fp = fopen(Filename, "w")))
    {
        fwrite(Memory, Length, 1, fp);
        fclose(fp);
        return true;
    }
    else
    {
        printf("UtMem2BinFile: Error Opening File: %s, %s\n", Filename, strerror(errno));
        UtAssert_True(false, "UtMem2BinFile: Error Opening File");
        return false;
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function UtMem2BinFile:
#define UtAssert_True(Expression, __VA_ARGS__) UtAssertEx(Expression,UtAssert_GetContext(),__FILE__,__LINE__,__VA_ARGS__)
...
UtAssert_CaseType_t UtAssert_GetContext(void)
{
    return DefaultContext;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I inspected the provided code and supporting definitions and found no use of the Standard Library function memcmp or any code that compares null‑terminated strings using memcmp. The function UtMem2BinFile calls fopen, fwrite, fclose, printf and strerror(errno) only; the UtAssert_True macro and UtAssert_GetContext do not contain memcmp either. There are also no occurrences of patterns that would indicate memcmp-based string comparisons (for example memcmp(s1,s2,n) or memcmp(s1,s2,strlen(s1)+1)). Therefore there are no code fragments in the supplied code that need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14.
